item.content:encoded: This knocked my socks off when I was 25 Read it most days since Taittiriya Upanishad
item.author: Patrick OShaughnessy

item.content:encoded: Trump’s aggressive stance toward Canada comes out of left field for most Americans, but @scoopercooper reporting in The Bureau consistently shows that top levels of Canadian govt and law enforcement may be widely compromised by organized crime & the CCP. The Bureau is Must-Read
item.author: MuddyWatersResearch

item.content:encoded: Musk is leading a war on workers, and in this issue, The Economist is cheering him on. In this work from home (WHF) piece, the corporatist magazine endorses the idea of reducing a worker’s wage if she elects to work remotely. All rationalized by a fancy economic study!!
item.author: Hal Singer

item.content:encoded: "For example, if we compare 2002 to 2022 – an even twenty years, and a timeframe with more reliable starting data than 1998 – Internet traffic increased by a factor of 1,000 while the price of transit decreased by a factor of 1,000. We could call that Jevons… Flatline?"
item.author: modest proposal

item.content:encoded: Finally in print! The idea of writing a paper about the minimum wage was pretty scary. I'm glad we did. We learned a lot. We hope you do too! The appendix and replication package, including tex files is on my website. Thanks to @ChadJonesEcon, who was an excellent editor.
item.author: Simon Mongey

item.content:encoded: President Xi didn’t even bother to fake giving him something. Trump just quietly surrendered in the dead of night. #FakeTariffs
item.author: Ron Filipkowski

item.content:encoded: Well when you put it like that…
item.author: BuccoCapital Bloke

item.content:encoded: In a large US sample, approximately half of all women discontinue antidepressant usage during pregnancy (no change in usage for spouses). This is in a new paper that I just published with @claireeboone and @ccolina_pe that is primarily descriptive.
item.author: Devin Pope

item.content:encoded: Spouse switched regular coffee with decaf w/o telling me, then followed up later w/ some data collection (which I mistook for a sign of care & interest). Calling the IRB.
item.author: John Horton

item.content:encoded:
The US government has now gutted all of the tools created to fight kleptocracy. It's going to be up to other democracies to save their political and financial systems from anonymous flows of cash.
https://t.co/a3BbrttFec
item.author: Anne Applebaum

item.content:encoded: Edward Coristine, a 19-year-old member of Elon Musk’s baby-faced programers, who have been given unprecedented access to sensitive government records, was fired from an internship after sharing information with a competitor. “Edward has been terminated for leaking internal
item.author: Cheri Jacobus
Hiroo Onoda

item.content:encoded: I don't get the deregulation push. We generally don't regulate firms in the U.S. economy. Not Big Tech, nor telecom, cable, airlines, ride share. Utilities are regulated. Banks are barely. We've rescinded regulations since Carter, and we've refrained from adopting new regulations
item.author: Hal Singer

item.content:encoded: New post! Looking at three recent papers on the productivity impacts of government funded research, both in the US and OECD. Across different methods, all find positive impacts.

item.content:encoded: Silicon Valley has spent the last 30 years: 1) Harvesting attention to sell ads 2) Building B2B software Don’t let anyone tell you otherwise

item.content:encoded: Nice to see that $MSFT continues to spend $18B/yr "buying back" stock to *not* decreased the share count; instead s/o ROSE. If 20% of its income is out the door with zero benefit to shareholders, only to, employees as of last Q that's SALARY EXPENSE. It's true margin is sub 30%
